channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: IRS refunds are 32% lower on average so far this tax season
Chile Declares Curfew as Power Outage Sweeps Country
item.description: Most residents had power restored by midnight but the situation remained unstable. President Gabriel Boric blamed power companies for not acting faste...

item.title: GM boosts investor payout with new buybacks, dividend hike
item.description: GM said the buyback has no expiration date but that it aims to complete the first $2 billion in repurchases by the end of the second quarter.

item.title: U.S.-Ukraine Minerals Deal Draft Features Vague Reference to Security Guarantees
item.description: A copy of the agreement obtained by The New York Times says that the United States “supports Ukraine’s effort to obtain security guarantees needed to ...

item.title: Washington Post Opinion Editor Exits as Bezos Steers Pages in New Direction
item.description: Jeff Bezos, the owner of The Post, said that the newspaper’s opinion section would focus on “personal liberties and free markets.”

item.title: Tim Walz Will Not Run for Minnesota’s Senate Seat
item.description: The Democrat, who rose from relative obscurity to be chosen as Kamala Harris’s running mate last year, says he will instead explore a third term as go...

item.title: UK’s Starmer to Meet Trump With a Boost on Defense and Pleas for Ukraine
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain, fresh from announcing a boost to military spending, is flying to Washington for a high-stakes visit.

item.title: What We Know About the U.S.-Ukraine Minerals Deal
item.description: A draft agreement discussed on Tuesday does not include a $500 billion payout the Trump administration demanded earlier.

item.title: Nvidia’s shaken aura of invincibility is set for an earnings test
item.description: "I'm not overly optimistic this will be the kind of report we’ve seen a lot from Nvidia ... That could lead to a massive selloff.”

item.title: Bayer CEO Bill Anderson on diversity initiatives, new menopause drugs and how to tame a runaway bureaucracy
item.description: Bayer's teams run on 90-day cycles, so the clock is always ticking on delivering on their goals.

item.title: What Can House Republicans Cut Instead of Medicaid? Not Much.
item.description: The math of the G.O.P.’s goals makes the move almost unavoidable.

item.title: BP to ‘Fundamentally Reset’ Strategy in Shift Back to Oil and Gas
item.description: The energy giant said it would cut planned investment in clean energy and redirect spending toward fossil fuels.

item.title: First measles death is reported in the West Texas outbreak that’s infected more than 120 people
item.description: Measles is a respiratory virus that can survive in the air for up to two hours. Up to 9 out of 10 people who are susceptible will get the virus if exp...

item.title: UK’s Starmer to Meet Trump With a Boost on Defense and Pleas for Ukraine
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain, fresh from announcing a boost to military spending, is flying to Washington for a high-stakes visit.

item.title: Military Plane Crash in Residential Area Kills at Least 46 in Sudan
item.description: The incident, whose cause was unknown, has added to the destruction wrought by years of civil war.
